p: Results of the analysis of the HW-M index also showed increases in the mean temperature during the HWs for all cities and RCPs, where Luxembourg showed the strongest increase ( Figure 6). For England and Wales 1.0% of all summer deaths were attributable to air temperature [ 51], and an increase of 1 °C corresponded to a 3.1% increase in daily mortality. In Mediterranean cities a 2% increase in mortality is associated with a rise of approximately 10 °C [ 13].
